The pure class interface. 
public static class Style
The class of styles, for GUIs.

Config()
Make this top-level form available in the configuration menu.
Function()
Make this top-level form available in the function menu.
HIDDEN
Make this top-level form only available in the command interpreter.
MenuAt(String[])
Make this top-level form available in some arbitrary other menu, specified by the given path.
Shell()
Make this top-level form available in the shell menu.
Source()
Make this top-level form available in the source menu.

If this flag is set, then the dialog (if any, i.e
toolIcon
If this string is not null, it should be a file name of an image relative to the images

Set the modal-flag of this style

Set the tool-icon of this style

Shell
public case Shell();
Make this top-level form available in the shell menu.

Source

public case Source();
Make this top-level form available in the source menu.

Function

public case Function();
Make this top-level form available in the function menu.

Config

public case Config();
Make this top-level form available in the configuration menu.

MenuAt

public case MenuAt(String[] path);
Make this top-level form available in some arbitrary other menu, specified by the given path.

HIDDEN

public case HIDDEN;
Make this top-level form only available in the command interpreter.

isModal
public boolean isModal;
If this flag is set, then the dialog (if any, i.e. if the top-level form isn't atomic) is made modal. False by default.

toolIcon

public String toolIcon;
If this string is not null, it should be a file name of an image relative to the images directory, and the form can be also reached via the tool bar under this icon. By default null.

setModal
public Style setModal(boolean yes);
Set the modal-flag of this style. Return this style.

setToolIcon

public Style setToolIcon(String toolIcon);
Set the tool-icon of this style. Return this style.
